text:
The ability to check on the status of threads in tomcat would be very useful,
the ability to drill down on individual threads even more so. I dont want
a performance trace/heap dump/etc, when you can buy JProbe - I'd like the
kind of stats that mod_status provides in Apache. (first byte response time,
bytes sent, url being processed, that kind of thing - from tomcats point of 
view)

See for example Bug#1798. We found this bug for ourselves by monitoring
server-status on the apache side; with extended status it showed us what
URLs were coming in and we were able to prove to ourselves that there
were processes hanging and that the URLs they were hanging on were not
the cause; hence we had an issue with the connector.

However, it proved difficult (and still proves difficult) to show that what
has happened is (eg) a servlet diving into an infinite loop, as opposed to
mod_jk failing to talk to tomcat - both show up as processes in a W state on
apache.

This may be in already in catalina, but its something that is an issue
using 3.2.x in a production environment.
creator: Brian.Ewins@btinternet.com
